intro: Nothoscordum setaceum, commonly known as the slender false garlic, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
